item.title: Introduction to Hamiltonian Monte Carlo
item.description: Introduction to Hamiltonian Monte Carlo Vinay Ramasesh, September 2018 Comments/questions/errata welcome: ramasesh@berkeley.edu This notebook is an updated one originally written for a Machine Learning at Berkeley reading group given Fall 2018, discussing the paper Generalizing Hamiltonian Monte Carlo with Neural Networks by Daniel Levy et al. This notebook doesn’t discuss the paper itself, but rather aims to introduce Hamiltonian Monte Carlo to undergraduates studying physics or CS who have limited-to-no experience with sampling, and only a basic understanding of probability distributions.
